Name: Grey Riding Camel
Notes_2: To obtain this camel, you first have to locate and click on one of the Mysterious Camel Figurines that appear sporadically in Uldum. Most of the time these will turn to dust, but if you're lucky it will instead transport you to Dormus the Camel-Hoarder (this NPC is in a special phase and cannot be reached any other way). The Grey Riding Camel may be looted from Dormus after he's defeated. See also Warcraft Secrets' guide on the method.
Requirements:
This mount is available to all eligible characters on your account.
Level 40
Journeyman (150) Riding
Source: Dormus the Camel-Hoarder in Accessed through Mysterious Camel Figurines in Uldum.

Name: Swift Lovebird
Notes_2: This pink tallstrider can only be obtained during the Love is in the Air festival, which occurs around the second half of February each year (close to Valentine's Day ). The Love Tokens used to purchase this mount can be earned by performing daily quests during the event. See the World of Warcraft Events Calendar for precise dates of this festival.
Requirements:
This mount is available to all eligible characters on your account.
Level 20
Apprentice (75) Riding

Name: Swift Springstrider
Notes_2:
This white tallstrider may only be obtained during the festival of Nobelgarden, which occurs around Easter - roughly March to April each year. The purchase of this mount requires a quirky currency: Noblegarden Chocolates, which are gathered by looting and opening Brightly Colored Eggs during Noblegarden. Extremely lucky participants may even find the Springstrider inside an egg, but this seems to be a very rare event.

The eggs are hidden around racial starting towns. Known locations are:
Alliance: Azure Watch, Dolanaar, Goldshire, Kharanos
Horde: Bloodhoof Village, Brill, Falconwing Square, Razor Hill
See the World of Warcraft Events Calendar for precise dates of this festival.
Requirements:
This mount is available to all eligible characters on your account.
Level 20
Apprentice (75) Riding
Source:
Noblegarden Merchant/Vendor in Capital Cities.
Cost: 500
Only available during Noblegarden

This seahorse can only be ridden in the waters of Vashj'ir - but in those zones it is much faster than any other aquatic mount.

It is a quest reward from The Abyssal Ride, which occurs in the earlier part of the Vashj'ir quest chain and isn't hard to obtain.

This mount is available to all eligible characters on your account.
Level 80
Expert (225) Riding

Name: Vicious War Steed
Notes_2:
To purchase this armoured steed you must be victorious in a great many rated arenas or battlegrounds in a single PvP season. The procedure is as follows:
You must reach the PvP rank of Combatant. You can obtain this ranking by reaching a rating of 1400 by competing in 2v2, 3v3, or 10v10 arenas and battlegrounds.
Once you've reached Combatant ranking you must win further matches in the same season, until your progress bar reaches 100% (2400 points). You'll then receive the current season's mount (not this one).
For each subsequent time you fill your progress bar during the season you'll receive a Vicious Saddle, which you may use to purchase older Vicious mounts, including this one.
It appears the 1400 rating is specific to the match type you earned it in. For example, if you only earned the rating in 10v10 then you cannot progress towards the mount in 2v2 (until you also earn a 1400 rating in the latter).
The number of matches required to fill your progress bar depends on the type of match. According to comments on Wowhead, by Rainewater, you require 40 wins from 10v10 (60 points / win), 80 wins from 3v3 (30 points / win), or 240 wins from 2v2 (10 points / win).
Requirements:
This mount is available to all eligible characters on your account.
Level 40
Journeyman (150) Riding
Alliance Only
Source:
Necrolord Sipe in Stormwind City.
Cost: 1

Name: Vicious War Wolf
Notes_2:
To purchase this armoured wolf you must be victorious in a great many rated arenas or battlegrounds in a single PvP season. The procedure is as follows:
You must reach the PvP rank of Combatant. You can obtain this ranking by reaching a rating of 1400 by competing in 2v2, 3v3, or 10v10 arenas and battlegrounds.
Once you've reached Combatant ranking you must win further matches in the same season, until your progress bar reaches 100% (2400 points). You'll then receive the current season's mount (not this one).
For each subsequent time you fill your progress bar during the season you'll receive a Vicious Saddle, which you may use to purchase older Vicious mounts, including this one.
It appears the 1400 rating is specific to the match type you earned it in. For example, if you only earned the rating in 10v10 then you cannot progress towards the mount in 2v2 (until you also earn a 1400 rating in the latter).
The number of matches required to fill your progress bar depends on the type of match. According to comments on Wowhead, by Rainewater, you require 40 wins from 10v10 (60 points / win), 80 wins from 3v3 (30 points / win), or 240 wins from 2v2 (10 points / win).
Requirements:
This mount is available to all eligible characters on your account.
Level 40
Journeyman (150) Riding
Horde Only
Source:
Deathguard Netharian in Orgrimmar.
Cost: 1
